{
  "article_text": [
    "semiconductor structures are considered as a perspective source of persistent terahertz radiation .",
    "@xcite in semiconductor superlattices the radiation is generated by bloch oscillations driven by the electric field @xmath0 applied in parallel with the growth direction , i.e. with the superlattice lattice vector . under influence of the electric field",
    "the wannier - stark ladder of quasi - stationary states is formed .",
    "the energy of emitted photons is determined by the separation between neighboring levels of the ladder , @xmath1 , where @xmath2 is the bloch oscillation frequency and @xmath3 denotes the period of the superlattice .",
    "even though the idea of bloch oscillations is old , it took a long time to find their experimental evidence .",
    "@xcite for brief review see , e.g. , hartmann _ et al . _",
    "@xcite and leo .",
    "@xcite    the strong transversal magnetic field has been used to quantize the free in - plane electron motion and to convert the quasi - three - dimensional electron structure of a superlattice to quasi - one - dimensional landau subbands , with the aim to change the electron dynamics and improve the condition for the terahertz emission , as described by patan _",
    "et al . _ ,  @xcite scalari  _ et al._,@xcite and references therein .",
    "completely different approach was used in our recent publication ,  @xcite where we have theoretically studied the influence of the strong in - plane magnetic field on the electronic structure of superlattices .",
    "we have considered the superlattice subject to crossed electric and magnetic fields , @xmath0 and @xmath4 , both applied `` in - plane '' , i.e. perpendicularly to the modulation direction , as an alternative source of radiation . in",
    "that case electrons are driven in parallel with the lattice vector by the lorentz force . as electrons tunnel through the barriers ,",
    "the cyclic motion along the electric field direction is superimposed to their otherwise straight - line drift due to the lorentz force .",
    "the corresponding terahertz frequency @xmath5 is related to this cyclic motion and depends not only on the electric field @xmath0 , as in the case of bloch oscillations , but also on the applied magnetic field @xmath4 .",
    "the frequency is given by @xmath6 where @xmath7 is the electron drift velocity .",
    "terahertz oscillations in still another configuration of the crossed fields was investigated experimentally by qureshi ,  @xcite who employed the transversal electric field , as in the standard bloch configuration , combined with a strong in - plane magnetic field .",
    "the chaotic dynamics of electrons in the presence of the crossed fields and in the tilted magnetic fields was theoretically studied in papers .  @xcite    the orientations of the electric and magnetic field with respect to the superlattice structure .",
    "configurations ( a ) and ( b ) are considered in sections iii . and iv .",
    ", respectively . ]    for bloch oscillations , the very important issue is the intersubband tunneling of the zener type .",
    "lot of efforts were spent to clarify the condition under which bloch oscillations could be observed and this problem is not yet definitely solved .",
    "@xcite the same question needs to be addressed to the alternative magnetic - field - induced oscillations as we did not pay enough attention to this point in our previous publication .",
    "@xcite    we will study the electrons in the presence of crossed magnetic and electric fields and subject to a unidirectional potential with the period determined by the lattice vector @xmath8 oriented in the growth direction of the superlattice .",
    "the considered geometrical arrangements of the fields and the superlattice are shown in fig .",
    "the magnetic field acts in the direction @xmath9 with a constant intensity @xmath10 and the electric field of a constant intensity @xmath11 is parallel with the @xmath12 axis .",
    "two directions of the lattice vector are considered with respect to the orientation of @xmath0 : the parallel one , @xmath13 , with the periodic potential potential @xmath14 , and the perpendicular one , @xmath15 , with the periodic potential @xmath16 .",
    "the former configuration corresponds to the bloch oscillations , the latter one to the alternative oscillations .    while the three - dimensional superlattices subject to in - plane",
    "electric and magnetic fields have been proposed as an alternative source of the terahertz oscillations , in our theoretical analysis the simpler two - dimensional model is employed . as the @xmath9-dependent part of the three - dimensional hamiltonian , @xmath17 , does not play any role in the following theoretical consideration ,",
    "we can omit it for simplicity without loss of generality .",
    "we start with description of a free electron in crossed fields .",
    "@xcite in general , the two - dimensional hamiltonian of an electron in the electromagnetic field reads @xmath18 where @xmath19 and @xmath20 .",
    "if we further assume @xmath21 and employ the landau gauge of the vector potential @xmath22 , the hamiltonian ( [ ham ] ) reduces to @xmath23 since @xmath24 commutes with @xmath25 , the separation of variables in the corresponding schrdinger equation is possible .",

    "the coordinate @xmath37 relates the center of the cyclotron orbit , given by @xmath38 , to the wave vector @xmath39 , @xmath40 . since",
    "@xmath41 the number of states in a landau level is given by @xmath42 and the level degeneracy reads @xmath43 very similar form of the eigenstates of the full hamiltonian @xmath24 is obtained if we sum in eq .",
    "( [ h0 ] ) the terms linear and quadratic in @xmath12 .",
    "then @xmath24 takes the form @xmath44 in which the drift velocity @xmath45 of an electron in crossed fields is employed .",
    "it follows from the similarity between expressions ( [ h0tilde ] ) and ( [ h01 ] ) that the eigenenergies of @xmath24 can be constructed from the zero - electric - field ones , @xmath46 , given by eq .",
    "( [ etilde ] ) .",
    "they can be expressed as @xmath47 where @xmath48 stands for @xmath49 .",
    "the landau levels become tilted and , therefore , their degeneracy in @xmath39 is lifted .",
    "the eigenfunctions @xmath50 remain practically unchanged , only the wave vector @xmath39 was replaced by @xmath48 in eq .",
    "( [ 0phi ] ) .    in comparison with the zero - electric - field case",
    "the diagonal matrix element of the velocity component is nonzero and given by @xmath51 and the center of mass of the cyclotron orbit reads @xmath52 .",
    "this well known example demonstrates that the electric field does change the zero - electric - field electronic structure only in an unessential way .",
    "both systems are described by almost equivalent hamiltonians which differ only by the shift of the coordinate center and the changes of the constants .",
    "we will show in the following sections that it is valid also in the presence of the superlattice periodic potential .",
    "in the zero - magnetic - field limit this geometrical arrangement would lead to the standard bloch oscillations . in crossed electric and magnetic fields",
    "the hamiltonian can be written as a sum of @xmath24 , as given by eq .",
    "( [ h01 ] ) , and of the periodic potential @xmath53 , @xmath54 the resulting hamiltonian reads @xmath55 similarly as in the case of a free electron described above , it is obvious that the eigenstates of @xmath56 are closely related to the eigenstates of the zero - electric - field hamiltonian @xmath57 for a given @xmath39 both hamiltonians reduce to one - dimensional ones , which differ only by a constant @xmath58 and a shift @xmath59 in the wave vector @xmath39 .",
    "therefore both hamiltonians yield essentially the same spectrum of eigenvalues .",
    "the eigenenergies of the hamiltonian ( [ h02 ] ) can be written , in analogy with eq .",
    "( [ e0n ] ) , as @xmath60 note that for the zero - electric - field case the periodic potential @xmath53 removes the degeneracy of landau levels .",
    "the eigenenergies of the hamiltonian ( [ h03 ] ) become the landau subbands @xmath61 , @xmath62 , periodic in @xmath39 with the period @xmath63 we replace @xmath64 by the integer @xmath65 to distinguish between a subband and a level .",
    "the corresponding eigenfuctions @xmath66 are , similarly as @xmath67 , bounded in @xmath12 direction for any @xmath39 due to the confinement by the parabolic potential generated by @xmath10 .",
    "the diagonal matrix elements of the velocity component @xmath68 in crossed fields are now given by @xmath69 and the center of mass of the cyclotron orbit reads @xmath70 it follows from eq .",
    "( [ en ] ) that @xmath71 is a step - like function with the step length @xmath72 and the step height @xmath73 , i.e. we can write @xmath74 where @xmath2 denotes the frequency of bloch oscillations .",
    "this step function replaces the standard wannier - stark ladder obtained in the zero - magnetic - field case .",
    "note that @xmath71 are the true eigenenergies and not the resonances as the wannier - stark states , i.e. the magnetic field completely suppresses the zener tunneling .",
    "the energy spectra of the above hamiltonians can be found either by the direct numerical solution of the corresponding one - dimensional schrdinger equations , or we can look for the eigenfunctions in the form of the linear combination of the free electron functions ( [ 0phi ] ) . as the resulting eigenenergies are the functions of @xmath39 , we can evaluate the matrix elements for a given @xmath39 and diagonalize the resulting matrix .",
    "the matrix elements of the hamiltonian @xmath75 , eq .",
    "( [ h03 ] ) , are diagonal in @xmath39 .",

    "therefore , we can look for the eigenfunctions @xmath79 in the form @xmath80 and the matrix elements of @xmath75 can be written as @xmath81 where @xmath82 is the matrix element of a component of the periodic potential @xmath83\\nonumber \\\\ & & \\times h_n\\left(\\frac{y - y_0}{\\ell}\\right ) h_{n'}\\left(\\frac{y - y_0}{\\ell}\\right ) \\cos\\left(g_jy\\right){\\mathrm d}y.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] introducing the dimensionless variable @xmath84 , we obtain @xmath85 to reduce this expression to a pair of standard tabular integrals we can employ the simple trigonometric relation @xmath86 after substitution , the examined @xmath82 is divided into two parts @xmath87 and @xmath88 . the first part , which includes the cosine in the integrand , is equal to zero if the integrand is the odd function . for the even integrand it reads @xmath89 the explicit analytic form of @xmath87 ( see , e.g . ,  @xcite )",

    "note that @xmath39 enters the matrix elements @xmath82 through the identity @xmath97 .",
    "only the minor changes are introduced by applying the electric field .",
    "the matrix elements of the hamiltonian ( [ h02 ] ) read @xmath98\\delta _ { n ,",

    "this arrangement corresponds to the alternative oscillations .",
    "the hamiltonian of an electron in crossed electric and magnetic fields with the periodic modulation in the @xmath102 direction can be written as a sum of the hamiltonian @xmath24 , as given by eq .",

    ". this function must be equivalent to @xmath61 found in the previous section , as the result should not depend on the choice of calibration of the vector potential .",
    "since the hamiltonian ( [ h04 ] ) can not be simply reduced to the one - dimensional one , we will look for the eigensolutions starting from the linear combination of eigenfunctions of @xmath24 .",

    "for a given @xmath48 , the matrix elements of the hamiltonian ( [ h04 ] ) can be written as @xmath115\\delta_{nj , n'j ' }   + t_{nj , n'j'}.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] here @xmath116 denotes the matrix elements of the potential @xmath103 .",
    "they are products of the matrix elements of @xmath117 , calculated between the plane - wave parts of the wave functions , and of the overlap integrals of localized functions @xmath118 . only the matrix elements @xmath119 are nonzero .",
    "the centers of overlapping functions are @xmath113 and @xmath120 , respectively , and their distance is @xmath121",
    ". then @xmath122 are equal to @xmath123 for @xmath124 and @xmath125 for @xmath126 .",
    "they decrease exponentially with the distance between the centers of functions @xmath127 and @xmath118 .",
    "note that the electric field @xmath11 ( the drift velocity @xmath128 ) and the wave vector @xmath48 enter only the diagonal part of the hamiltonian , and , therefore , only the diagonal elements of the corresponding matrix equation which reads @xmath129 this allows us to predict an interesting @xmath48 dependence of the eigenstates of the above equation .",
    "first , it follows from the form of the matrix elements of the hamiltonian  ( [ hwith ] ) that the eigenenergies depend linearly on @xmath48 , and that the electrons move , in spite of the presence of the superlattice potential , with the same drift velocity @xmath128 as free electrons in crossed fields .",

    "( [ schwith ] ) should reduce for @xmath137 to the zero - field eigenvalues @xmath138 periodic in @xmath108 .",

    "it is not too difficult to introduce the electric field into this simple model .",
    "first , the @xmath39 must be replaced by @xmath48 and @xmath149 by @xmath162 in @xmath163 .",
    "then we can calculate the matrix elements of the hamiltonian  ( [ hwith ] ) , which include the @xmath48 and @xmath128 dependent parts .",
    "we get @xmath164,\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] and thus , taking into account the periodicity in @xmath108 , the eigenenergies of the corresponding equation can be easily calculated : @xmath165 in this example we limited our consideration to one subband @xmath107 .",
    "note that for more subbands the electric field can not cause the intersubband transition , as we use the electric - field - dependent basis of functions @xmath166 .",
    "therefore , the solutions of eq .",
    "( [ schwith ] ) are the eigenstates and not the resonances .",
    "the presented theoretical analysis has implicitly assumed a single electron model for a bloch electron in crossed electric and magnetic fields , @xmath167 , moving in a perfect superlattice crystal with the lattice vector @xmath8 .",
    "two geometrical arrangements were considered .    in the case",
    "@xmath168 , which would correspond to the bloch oscillations for @xmath169 , the magnetic field converts the standard wannier - stark ladder of resonances to the step - like eigenenergies , which are functions of the wave vector @xmath170 , perpendicular to both @xmath0 and @xmath4 .",
    "the step length is @xmath171 .",
    "the step height @xmath172 corresponds to the frequency of the bloch oscillations @xmath173 .",
    "the alternative magnetic - field - induced oscillations were suggested as a possible source of terahertz radiation  @xcite for the case @xmath174 .",
    "the electron motion is composed from oscillations along @xmath8 and the drift due to the lorentz force with the velocity @xmath45 in the direction of @xmath170 .",
    "the resulting eigenstates resemble those of a free electron in crossed fields .",
    "the eigenenergies @xmath175 depends linearly on the @xmath176 , @xmath177 , their separation on the energy scale is @xmath178",
    ".    the above conclusions are valid for the optimal conditions for coherent bloch and alternative oscillations , neglecting the importance of additional scattering which can lead to damping of oscillations .",
    "this work has been supported by the ministry of education of the czech republic center for fundamental research lc510 , the ministry of education of the czech republic research plan msm 0021620834 , and academy of sciences of the czech republic project kan400100652 .",
    "t.  m.  fromhold , a.  patan , s.  bujkewicz , p.  b.  wilkinson , d.  fowler , d.  sherwood , s.  p.  stapleton , a.  a.  krokhin , l.  eaves , m.  henini , n.  s.  sankeshwar , and f.  w.  sheard , nature ( london ) 428 , 726 ( 2004 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we have studied bloch electrons in a perfect unidirectional superlattice subject to crossed electric and magnetic fields , where the magnetic field is oriented `` in - plane '' , i.e. in parallel to the sample plane . </S>",
    "<S> two orientation of the electric field are considered . </S>",
    "<S> it is shown that the magnetic field suppresses the intersubband tunneling of the zener type , but does not change the frequency of bloch oscillations , if the electric field is oriented perpendicularly to both the sample plane and the magnetic field . the electric field applied in - plane ( but perpendicularly to the magnetic field ) </S>",
    "<S> yields the step - like electron energy spectrum , corresponding to the magnetic - field - tunable oscillations alternative to the bloch ones . </S>"
  ]
}
